children: A 33-year-old man is evaluated for cough, shortness of breath, and a new pulmonary infiltrate. He received mantle radiation for Hodgkin disease 12 weeks ago.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is radiation pneumonitis, which typically occurs 4 to 12 weeks after initial radiation exposure. High-resolution CT in radiation pneumonitis will demonstrate ground-glass opacities, usually within the field of radiation exposure. A well-defined nonanatomic demarcation between normal and abnormal lung consistent with the radiation field is pathognomonic but not always present. This patient's chest CT scan
